page.title: 02St.Albans Cathedral.
page.content: The {Abbey Church}of the Benedictine monastry grew up on the site where {St.Alban}was probably buried. The remains of the marble {shrine,}the heart of the mediaeval church, is still visited by{pilgrims}today. The {nave}is the longest in England and the {Norman Tower}contains Roman bricks from Verulamium. Every century has added more to the building which was restored by Lord Grimthorpe in the 19th Century and became a {Cathedral in 1877. It has a {parish }as well as a {diocese}and large,lively congregations. There are three services a day and many weddings and baptisms. The {music }is provided by a choir and organ. There is a biennial organ{festival }and many concerts.
